text: Can anyone tell me if there is an endpoint in the Deals api where i can get all properties of a deal?

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/properties>

GET*`/crm/v3/properties/{objectType}`*

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/deals>

Can someone tell me how my URL should look to get associated companies to a deal using dealid ?  as far as i can understand the old v1 api returned the associated companies etc. but v3 does not, guess there is a reason for this and now a better way to get associations or?

I don't think you'll have it but to confirm you'll have to build it out in there

Yes:raised_hands: its working like a charm

no problem
glad I could help

yeah you can use this:
```<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v4/objects/deals/{DealID}?associations=companies>```
`<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v4/objects/deals/{DealID}?properties=amount,dealname,etc,etc>`
replace etc with whatever properties you want to get
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C019VT42R8X/p1681278088866279>
Do you have the transactional email addon?
If so you can use the transactional email api
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/marketing/transactional-emails>

Hi all,

Is there a straight forward way to collect Assiciations from the API?
So far I have found the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/associations|associations-endpoint> but if I'm not mistaken I have to supply every contact id separately.

Is there a way to get the mxn table of associations between contacts and deals only?
Or otherwise what is the smartest way to use it without killing the number of API calls?
what's the end goal?
supply a list of contacts and get all the associated deals?
to match contacts and deals in an external database
and to do this you want to batch a group of contacts together and read those associations in bulk?
yes
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/associations>
I would suggest using the batch read association endpoint then:
You can submit 11,000 contact ids per request
although I would suggest limiting to 1,000
oh wonderful, thank you!
of course

```ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'HubSpot.crm.objects.notes'```
What is the end point URL to update the contact
have you pip installed HubSpot?
same endpoint just add the contact id to the end of the url like this: '<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts/2323423>' and set the method to PATCH instead of POST
do you want to share your entire code?

Hey, can anyone tell me if I can import products with HubSpot API import? It's not mentioned in the docs: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/imports>
Yes, and I've been using it for a few months now with no issue, and I was just running a test of the functionality so I was using the code straight from the site

import HubSpot
from pprint import pprint
from HubSpot.crm.objects.notes import SimplePublicObjectInputForCreate, ApiException

client = HubSpot.Client.create(access_token="YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN")

properties = {
    "hs_timestamp": "2019-10-30T03:30:17.883Z",
    "hs_note_body": "Spoke with decision maker john",
    "HubSpot_owner_id": "11349275740"
}
simple_public_object_input_for_create = SimplePublicObjectInputForCreate(properties=properties, associations=[{"to":{"id":"101"},"types":[{"associationCategory":"HubSpot_DEFINED","associationTypeId":2}]}])
try:
    api_response = client.crm.objects.notes.basic_api.create(simple_public_object_input_for_create=simple_public_object_input_for_create)
    pprint(api_response)
except ApiException as e:
    print("Exception when calling basic_api->create: %s\n" % e)

Based on the documentation it looks like the products file needs to be imported just like a CRM-UI import:

> Before starting your import, learn more about the <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/crm-setup/set-up-your-import-file|objects and activities that can be imported, as well as file and property requirements.>
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/crm-setup/set-up-your-import-file#one-object-or-activity>

Hello all, right now I'm running a DELETE request through Zapier's new Beta API Request action and I see myself not being able to filter for specific calls.
The goal is to filter out specific calls that were made and delete those that match a certain criteria.
I'm aware of the SEARCH request of HubSpot, but I cannot add it to the Action zap in Zapier.
I wondered if you know which params I could add to this HTTPS request? In the screenshot below, you'll see where I'm currently hitting a wall. It's not possible to find the call and delete it with a filter.
Finding the call using a specific ID isn't a problem. Any help would be much appreciated!
which properties are you trying to filter on?
what's the end goal? Get a group of calls based on property matches and delete all of those? Or setup a trigger for whenever a new call is made see if it matches the criteria and then delete it
Is this task comes at calendar and do you know how to add a campaign to it?

Yes! The second part. The zap should activate when a new engagement call is made through ZOOM. But there are a couple of properties in the metadata that I want to call as well.
But I need to add a bit of complex logic doing ORs and ANDs.
For example, I'd like to filter for allAccessibleTeamIds OR any call that has less than 5 minutes in metadata.durationMilliseconds.
This is how zapier shows the data
~yes this task would show up on the Calendar~
but you can’t associate with a campaign through the API.

This task would not show up on the calendar. My mistake.

You can only do that through the UI right now. You could submit a idea on the community.
And the issue you're running into is that the delete isn't deleting
and or the filter isn't filtering correctly

I think it's 90 days

<@U01G8SAK0LC> I'm sorry bro today has been a long day and I didn't take the time to review either this message or the first message. Very sorry for the way I handled things. Just for future reference though, that right side code sample isn't tied to the api specs but the left side bar is, so I wouldn't follow it 100% of the time

Is it possible to create a new owner via the api? I'm doing some testing in the sandbox and I want to test the creation of an owner and then have it be assigned to another object. Is this possible?

Yeah you can do this through the user provisioning api. Just keep in mind that this will actually invite a new user to the HubSpot account. Owners are actually full on HubSpot users. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/settings/user-provisioning>
Thanks! Kind of sucks that the user gets notified, but I suppose I can just use my own email for testing.
Yeah just add like a + to your email that way it will create a different contact
so like if you use this email: <mailto:nerds@gmail.com|nerds@gmail.com>
use this for the next owner: <mailto:nerds+1@gmail.com|nerds+1@gmail.com>

In the doc example, there is "sendWelcomeEmail" attribute. I set it to false and I didn't get notified.
```{
  "email": "<mailto:newUser@email.com|newUser@email.com>",
  "roleId": "100",
  "primaryTeamId": "101",
  "secondaryTeamIds": [
    "102"
  ],
  "sendWelcomeEmail": "true"```
Oh awesome

Hi people - looking for some confirmation on a detail when using the v4 associations API.

The v4 associations api has a 500 per page, 1000 per “call” limit. I want to avoid hitting that 1000 limit.

If I use the “after” query param - that won’t count as the same call, will it?


It’s using the paging.next.link token that will lead it to being grouped with the previous call, no?

Otherwise, how would you even go about retrieving associated records if the total count is above 1000 when using this endpoint.

On a somewhat related note, I see they’ve changed how they use the “after” param, at least for this one. Used to be/is based on the count of the returned results per page for the v3 endpoints. So if you were using the search endpoint - limit= 100, after = 0 - 1st page,  after = 100 - 2nd page, and so on. But upon hitting 10,000 total - you’d get an error if you tried to go beyond. Which, while annoying, could be worked with by sorting by create date or something and using the last returned record ID as a filter in the subsequent calls. They’re using the last returned object’s ID as the token now, presumably based on an ascending sort.

Appreciate it.

The delete is working perfectly fine, the issue is that I cannot filter for what I want to delete. I'm not 100% sure how to add the criteria I want to filter for inside this zap.
Jeppe is my boss, hi Jeppe :smiley:
<@U01QVR44MEY> Did you manage to figure something out?
Nice that you keep helping <@U01QVR44MEY> :slightly_smiling_face: I have delegated the task to someone a bit more skilled that me :slightly_smiling_face:
